CoreGroup.description: Default Core Group. The default core group cannot be deleted.
CoreGroup.name: DefaultCoreGroup

J2CResourceAdapter.description: Built-in Relational Resource Adapter for WebSphere Persistence
J2CResourceAdapter.name: WebSphere Relational Resource Adapter

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Specify whether connection handles support implicit reactivation. (Smart Handle support). Value may be "true" or "false".
J2EEResourceProperty.name: InactiveConnectionSupport

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Type of transaction resource registration (enlistment). Valid values are either "static" (immediate) or "dynamic" (deferred).
J2EEResourceProperty.name: TransactionResourceRegistration

J2CResourceAdapter.description: Built-in Relational Resource Adapter for WebSphere Persistence
J2CResourceAdapter.name: WebSphere Relational Resource Adapter

J2CResourceAdapter.description: Built-in Relational Resource Adapter for WebSphere Persistence
J2CResourceAdapter.name: WebSphere Relational Resource Adapter

J2CResourceAdapter.description: Built-in Relational Resource Adapter for WebSphere Persistence
J2CResourceAdapter.name: WebSphere Relational Resource Adapter

CMPConnectorFactory.cmpDatasource: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC for SQL Server DataSource
CMPConnectorFactory.name: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC for SQL Server DataSource_CF

J2CResourceAdapter.description: Built-in Relational Resource Adapter for WebSphere Persistence
J2CResourceAdapter.name: WebSphere Relational Resource Adapter

DataSource.description: Default data source for WebSphere EJB Timer Service
DataSource.name: DefaultEJBTimerDataSource

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Allows the Derby database to be upgraded.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: connectionAttributes

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Location of Derby default database for the EJB Timer Service.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: databaseName

JDBCProvider.description: IBM WebSphere Connect JDBC driver for MS SQL Server.
JDBCProvider.name: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC driver for MS SQL Server
JDBCProvider.providerType: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC driver for MS SQL Server

DataSource.name: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC for SQL Server DataSource
DataSource.providerType: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC driver for MS SQL Server

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The workstation ID, which typically is the network name of the computer on which the application resides. If specified, this value is stored in the hostname column of the master.dbo.sysprocesses table and can be returned by sp_who and the Transact-SQL HOST_NAME function. The value can be useful for database administration purposes.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: WSID

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. Enables support for connection failover. The value of the AlternateServers connection option is a string that specifies the server name and port number of alternate servers that can be tried if the primary server is not accepting connections for some reason. This string has the format: (servername1:port1,servername2:port2, ..., servernameN:portN). To use named instances, the format is: (servername1\\instance1,servername2\\instance2, ..., servernameN\\instanceN). See the Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: alternateServers

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Determines how to report results generated by database triggers (stored procedures which run when a table is modified). See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: alwaysReportTriggerResults

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Windows Authentication to Microsoft SQL Server is not supported by WebSphere Application Server.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: authenticationMethod

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Specifies the codepage the driver uses when converting character data. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: codePageOverride

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up
J2EEResourceProperty.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. The number of times to retry connections to a list of database servers (primary and alternate) until a successful connection is established. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: connectionRetryCount

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. The number of seconds to wait before retrying a list of database servers (primary and alternate). See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: connectionRetryDelay

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The name of the Data Source.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: dataSourceName

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The database name. For example, enter sample to make your Data Source point to sample
J2EEResourceProperty.name: databaseName

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: dbFailOverEnabled

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Possible values are 'describeIfString' and 'noDescribe' (the default). When describeParameters is set to 'describeIfString', the JDBC driver attempts to describe all parameters in a single statement. The driver does not describe parameters for batch statements. If the driver is able to determine the datatype/collation information for the parameters, the driver sends the column's data in a format compatible with the column's data type. CHAR and VARCHAR columns are sent as BIGVARCHAR and translated to the appropriate character set. TEXT columns are sent as TEXT and are also translated to the appropriate character set. NCHAR and NVARCHAR columns are sent as NVARCHAR, while NTEXT is sent as NTEXT. If the driver is not able to determine the datatype/collation information for the parameters, the driver defaults to it's prior behavior. That is, it sends the data as BIGVARCHAR/TEXT or NVARCHAR/NTEXT based on the setting of SendStringParametersAsUnicode. Previously, the JDBC driver always sent ascii input streams as BIGVARCHAR and character stream readers as NVARCHAR. When describeParameters is set to 'noDescribe', the JDBC driver continues this behavior. However, when set to 'describeIfString', the JDBC driver sends the data as the column type defined on the server and translates as needed.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: describeParameters

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The description of this datasource.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: description

J2EEResourceProperty.description: When true, two phase connections are used. When false, one phase connections are used. Do not change this value because this value is set for with this provider
J2EEResourceProperty.name: enable2Phase

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Determines whether a cancel request sent as the result of a query timing out is subject to the same query timeout value as the statement it cancels. If set to true, the cancel request times out using the same timeout value, in seconds, that is set for the statement it cancels. For example, if your application sets Statement.setQueryTimeout(5) on a statement and that statement is cancelled because its timeout value was exceeded, a cancel request is sent that also will time out if its execution exceeds 5 seconds. If the cancel request times out, the driver throws an exception indicating that the cancel request was timed out and the connection is no longer valid. If set to false (the default), the cancel request does not time out.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: enableCancelTimeout

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Determines the amount of memory used by the driver to cache insensitive result set data. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: insensitiveResultSetBufferSize

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Determines whether the driver uses its internal conversion algorithm or the JVM conversion algorithm when converting double or float values to string values. If set to true, the driver uses the JVM algorithm when converting double or float values to string values. If set to false (the default), the driver uses its internal algorithm when converting double or float values to string. Setting the property to false improves performance; however, slight rounding differences can occur when compared to the same conversion using the JVM algorithm. These differences are within the allowable error of the double and float data types.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: javaDoubleToString

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections from this datasource.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Determines whether to use client load balancing in attempts to connect to a list of database servers (primary and alternate). See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: loadBalancing

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect a database. If this value is non-zero, attempt to connect to the database will timeout when this specified value is reached.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: loginTimeout

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the network interface card of the application connecting to Microsoft SQL Server. The value of this property appears in the net_address column of the master.dbo.sysprocesses table and can be useful for database administration purposes.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: netAddress

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. PacketSize={-1 | 0 | x}. Determines the number of bytes for each network packet transferred from the database server to the client machine. Adjusting the packet size can improve performance. The optimal value depends on the typical size of data inserted, updated, or retrieved by the application and the environment in which it is running. Typically, larger packet sizes work better for large amounts of data. For example, if an application regularly retrieves character values that are 10,000 characters in length, using a value of 32 (16 KB) typically results in improved performance. If set to -1, the driver uses the default packet size used by the database server. If set to 0 (the default), the driver uses a packet size of 8 KB. If set to x, an integer from 1 to 128, the driver uses a packet size that is a multiple of 512 bytes. For example, PacketSize=8 means to set the packet size to 8 * 512 bytes (4096 bytes).
J2EEResourceProperty.name: packetSize

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The TCP/IP port number where the MS SQL Server resides.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: portNumber

J2EEResourceProperty.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1 FROM TABLE1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table TABLE1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: preTestSQLString

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The name of the application connecting to Microsoft SQL Server. The value of this property appears in the program_name column of the master.dbo.sysprocesses table and can be useful for database administration purposes.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: programName

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: reauthentication

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. Specifies how the JDBC driver describes String stored procedure output parameters to the database. Valid values are NVARCHAR, VARCHAR, and DESCRIBE. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: receiveStringParameterType

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Controls whether the driver performs additional processing and catalog queries needed to determine the correct table name for each result set column when the ResultSetMetaData.getTableName(), ResultSetMetaData.getSchemaName(), and ResultSetMetaData.getCatalogName() methods are called. Valid values are 1 and 0. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: resultsetMetaDataOptions

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Determine whether or not Microsoft SQL Server 'server cursors' are used for SQL queries. Values are 'cursor' or 'direct'. The default is 'direct'. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: selectMethod

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Determines whether string parameters are sent to the SQL Server database in Unicode or in the default character encoding of the database. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: sendStringParametersAsUnicode

J2EEResourceProperty.description: This is a required property. The name of the server where MS SQL Server resides.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: serverName

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. The SnapshotSerializable custom data source property alters the meaning of the java.sql.Connection.TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE constant to represent the Snapshot isolation level, provided ALLOW_SNAPSHOT_ISOLATION is configured on the database.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: snapshotSerializable

J2EEResourceProperty.description: JDBC driver level trace attributes. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for a full list of options.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: spyAttributes

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. Determines whether the driver uses server-side cursors when an updatable result set is requested. If set to true, server-side updatable cursors are created when an updatable result set is requested. If set to false (the default), the default updatable result set functionality is used.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: useServerSideUpdatableCursors

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: validateNewConnection

J2EEResourceProperty.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up
J2EEResourceProperty.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount

J2EEResourceProperty.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds
J2EEResourceProperty.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval

TypedProperty.description: Trust Association Interceptors in this list will be invoked after Single Sign On user validation.
TypedProperty.name: com.ibm.websphere.security.DeferTAItoSSO

ThreadPool.description: Service integration bus FAP outbound channel thread pool
ThreadPool.name: SIBFAPThreadPool

ThreadPool.description: This pool is used by WebSphere during server startup.
ThreadPool.name: server.startup

ThreadPool.description: Service integration bus FAP inbound channel thread pool
ThreadPool.name: SIBFAPInboundThreadPool

ThreadPool.description: Service integration bus FAP outbound channel thread pool
ThreadPool.name: SIBFAPThreadPool

ThreadPool.description: This pool is used by WebSphere during server startup.
ThreadPool.name: server.startup

VariableSubstitutionEntry.description: The filesystem path to the directory which will contain installed enterprise applications.
The directory that contains the unbranded ConnectJDBC type 4 JDBC Driver for MS SQL Server.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain installed connectors.
The directory that contains the DB2 JDBC Driver on zSeries.

Specifies the fully qualified name of the directory containing native files (e.g., .so files) needed by the DB2 Universal JDBC Driver for processing. Normally the value should be left null. The only time a value should be specified is under WAS z/OS when DB2 V8 or higher is installed. In this case, there are .so files that are installed which are needed for DB2 Universal JDBC Driver processing.
The directory that contains the DB2 Universal JDBC driver.
The directory that contains the DB2 JDBC Driver.
The filesystem path to the installation directory for WebSphere EJB Deployment tool.
The directory that contains the Derby jar files.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain drivers.
The directory that contains the Informix JDBC Driver.
The filesystem path to the Java Virtual Machine installation directory.
The filesystem patch the pointers to the JVM Cache for the current node are held
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain server log files.
The filesystem path to the installation directory for WebSphere MQ client libraries.
The directory that contains the Microsoft JDBC driver for MSSQLServer 2000.
The directory that contains the Oracle thin or oci8 JDBC Driver.
The directory that contains the native JDBC Driver for local DB2 connections on iSeries.
The directory that contains the IBM Toolbox JDBC Driver for remote DB2 connections on iSeries.
The directory that contains the Sybase JDBC Driver.
The directory that contains the DB2 Universal JDBC driver license file.
The filesystem path to the user installaton directory.
The directory where contains the dirver from Custom JDBC2.0-compliant Provider.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain etc config files.
The product library for the i5/OS WebSphere product installation.
The filesystem path to the WebSphere product installation directory.
The filesystem path to the product lib directory.
The filesystem path to the product properties directory.
The filesystem path to the product temp directory.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain installed enterprise applications.
The directory that contains the unbranded ConnectJDBC type 4 JDBC Driver for MS SQL Server.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain installed connectors.
The directory that contains the DB2 JDBC Driver on zSeries.

Specifies the fully qualified name of the directory containing native files (e.g., .so files) needed by the DB2 Universal JDBC Driver for processing. Normally the value should be left null. The only time a value should be specified is under WAS z/OS when DB2 V8 or higher is installed. In this case, there are .so files that are installed which are needed for DB2 Universal JDBC Driver processing.
The directory that contains the DB2 Universal JDBC driver.
The directory that contains the DB2 JDBC Driver.
The filesystem path to the installation directory for WebSphere EJB Deployment tool.
The directory that contains the Derby jar files.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain drivers.
The directory that contains the Informix JDBC Driver.
The filesystem path to the Java Virtual Machine installation directory.
The filesystem patch the pointers to the JVM Cache for the current node are held
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain server log files.
The filesystem path to the installation directory for WebSphere MQ client libraries.
The directory that contains the Microsoft JDBC driver for MSSQLServer 2000.
The directory that contains the Oracle thin or oci8 JDBC Driver.
The directory that contains the native JDBC Driver for local DB2 connections on iSeries.
The directory that contains the IBM Toolbox JDBC Driver for remote DB2 connections on iSeries.
The directory that contains the Sybase JDBC Driver.
The directory that contains the DB2 Universal JDBC driver license file.
The filesystem path to the user installaton directory.
The directory where contains the dirver from Custom JDBC2.0-compliant Provider.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain etc config files.
The product library for the i5/OS WebSphere product installation.
The filesystem path to the WebSphere product installation directory.
The filesystem path to the product lib directory.
The filesystem path to the product properties directory.
The filesystem path to the product temp directory.
The log root directory for server server1.
Name of the application server.
